1.content:
Tom woke up. He had slept for three hours, but the messed-up part was that the clock said “18.34”. His half hour nap had turned into a cornucopia of sleep.

It hit him that he was quite hungry. As he was just about to walk into the kitchen, he noticed the door that led to the stairwell from his apartment was opened a little bit, which was odd, since he lived alone.

He took a second to figure out what to do…
1.title: Chapter 1 - Tom's adventure starts

14.content:
A little startled by the knock, Tom walked slowly and a bit fearfully across his bedroom and into the small entrance room, which had one door facing the kitchen, another one facing his bedroom and the aforementioned entrance door facing the stairwell, of his apartment.

It was a rather small and cramped apartment, but Tom was generally happy there.

Although, at this moment, for every second and every step, he took towards the entrance door, he asked himself who had knocked?
14.title: There is a knock on the door, before Tom decide...

info.brief_description: Brevity is key for this story, which means each chapter shouldn't be longer than 500 words
info.description:
The point of this story (also my first OWN interactive story) is to put more focus on the choices. In fact, I want it to be extremely focused on these, so it doesn't take too long for any reader to reach the next choice.

Of course, this will mean that the stories of each chapter have to be extremely simple, but why not try it out as an experiment.

Therefore, the rules are as follows:

1) Be as brief as possible (no more than 500 words per chapter)
2) Always create four choices at the end (three, if you are a free member or visitor)
3) Keep the writing in the 3rd person past tense
4) Keep the writing for the choices in the 3rd person present tense
5) The main character's name is "Tom" (don't change that)
6) Respect other people's stories and build upon them reasonably
7) Have fun and enjoy!
